# ‚ú® Feature request / Extension proposal

## Short summary
Provide a concise one-line summary of the proposed feature or extension.

## Motivation (Why?)
- What problem does this feature solve?
- Who benefits (developers, teachers, users)?

## Use case / Example
Describe a concrete scenario where the extension would be used. Include a small example, command, or pseudocode if helpful.

## Proposed solution
Explain the proposed change in enough detail for maintainers to evaluate it:
- What new commands, APIs, GUI elements, or file formats are required?
- How would the CLI or UI look (example commands, flags, menu items)?

## Technical details (optional)
- Likely areas of the codebase that would be affected (packages, classes, modules)
- Compatibility requirements (Java version, dependencies)

## Backwards compatibility & migration
- Will this change break existing APIs or files?
- Are migration steps or upgrade scripts needed?

## Acceptance criteria ‚úÖ
List 2‚Äì5 verifiable criteria that demonstrate the feature is implemented and working.
- [ ] Criterion 1
- [ ] Criterion 2

## Minimal viable prototype
Describe the smallest functional prototype that demonstrates the idea.

## Tests & Documentation
- Which tests are required (unit, integration, UI)?
- Which documentation pages should be updated or added?

## Alternatives considered
If you evaluated alternatives, briefly list them and why they were rejected.

## Attachments
Attach mockups, screenshots, logs, or links to prototypes if available. üìé

Optional (for maintainers):
- Recommended area / owner: (e.g. core, gui, plugins)
- Suggested labels / milestone
